text: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL) have catalyzed a significant transformation in advanced robotics in recent years. These technologies are imbuing robots with enhanced intelligence, efficiency, and adaptability, enabling them to tackle complex tasks and operate in diverse environments. Key applications of AI, ML, and DL in advanced robotics encompass autonomous navigation, object recognition and manipulation, natural language processing, and predictive maintenance. Moreover, they are pivotal in the development of collaborative robots (cobots) that can seamlessly interact with humans and flexibly adapt to dynamic environments and tasks.In addition to robotics, AI, ML, and DL are reshaping advanced transportation systems, ensuring safety, efficiency, and convenience for passengers and transportation companies alike. These technologies are also revolutionizing manufacturing assembly robots, enabling them to work with increased efficiency, safety, and intelligence. Furthermore, in aviation management, AI, ML, and DL are driving improvements in operational efficiency, cost reduction, and enhanced customer satisfaction for airlines. Taxi companies are also leveraging these technologies to provide superior, more efficient, and safer services to customers.This research provides an overview of the current developments in AI, ML, and DL in advanced robotics systems, exploring their diverse applications and discussing their potential for robot enhancement. Moreover, it identifies opportunities for further research to address existing gaps in the literature and advance the capabilities of advanced robotics systems. By harnessing the power of AI, ML, and DL, it is possible to optimize the performance of advanced robots across various applications, thereby bolstering productivity in advanced robotic industries.
